question: Will it snow in New Yorks' Central Park on Christmas Eve (Dec 24)?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes”, if the accumulation of new snow observed ("New snow") on December 24th 2021 by the National Weather Service in Central Park Area, NY, is 0.1 inches or higher, and "No" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market is NOAA Online Weather Data, published by National Weather Service on their website: https://www.weather.gov/wrh/Climate?wfo=okx.

The check will be at 12:00 PM ET December 25. 

Please note, if "T" appears as the daily snowfall measurement, it means that on that day snow continually melts as it lands and is recorded as a trace (T). If that occurs for December 24 in Central Park, NY - then this market resolves to "No".

question: Will at least 1% of U.S. COVID-19 cases be from the Omicron variant on January 1, 2022?
description:
This will resolve to "Yes" if, according to the CDC, the share of the Omicron (B.1.1.529) variant has 1.0% or more proportion of SARS-CoV-2 circulating variants in the USA for the week ending on January 1, 2022. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The market will be resolved on the CDC's Nowcast model that estimates more recent proportions of circulating variants. The week bar which ends on January 1, 2022 will be clicked, and the % TOTAL column in the table which refers to the Omicron variant will used for the resolution of this market. If the data moves or changes, or the link changes, these new changes and/or link which delineate % TOTAL will be used. 

The market will resolve as soon as the CDC publishes the Nowcast estimates for the week ending January 1, 2022 - which is scheduled for January 4th. Data will be checked at 8:00 PM ET, January 4, 2022, and every day subsequently if data is not available. 

If data is not available for the week ending on January 1, 2022 by January 10, 2022, the market will resolve based on the most recent weekly data before January 1, 2022. 

-------------------------------

Please note, Nowcast does not predict future spread of the virus nor it provides exact current data, but it does help estimate current prevalence of variants, based on genomic surveillance data from previous weeks. Estimates of variant proportions for previous weeks may change as more data are reported. Nowcast estimates consistently align with the weighted proportions based on reported sequencing data, which are published 2-3 weeks later.

To identify and track SARS-CoV-2 variants, CDC uses genomic surveillance. 

The CDC provides weekly Nowcast estimates which are updated every week on Tuesday.

events.title: What percent of US COVID-19 cases will be from the Omicron variant on January 1, 2022?
events.description: This is a market group on the percent of US COVID-19 cases originating from the Omicron variant on January 1, 2022, according to CDC's nowcast https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#variant-proportions.

question: Will Poland or the United Kingdom report a higher 7-day COVID-19 case average per capita on Christmas Eve?
description:
This is a market on whether Poland or the United Kingdom will report a higher 7-day COVID-19 case average per capita on December 24, 2021.

This market will resolve on data aggregated by Our World in Data, specifically, the 7-day rolling average of COVID-19 cases for Poland and the United Kingdom, with Metric "Confirmed Cases", Interval "7-day rolling average", and the Relative to Population checkbox checked, which is available at https://ourworldindata.org/explorers/coronavirus-data-explorer.

The resolution source will be reviewed on December 25th at 11 PM ET and - if the data for December 24 will not be available then - checked again every 12 hours, until the final check on December 30, 11 PM ET. 
If the data is not available by then, this market will resolve based on other credible sources for the day of December 24. 

If Poland has a higher 7-day COVID-19 case average per capita for the day of December 24, 2021, the market will resolve to "Poland." If the United Kingdom has a higher 7-day COVID-19 case average per capita for the day of December 24, 2021, the market will resolve to "United Kingdom." If the averages per capita are the same, the market will resolve 50/50.
--------------------

OWiD dataset uses the most recent official numbers from governments and health ministries worldwide. Population estimates for per-capita metrics are based on the United Nations World Population Prospects. 

Here: https://github.com/owid/covid-19-data/tree/master/public/data one can find a detailed list of all our country-specific sources.

question: Will California or Florida have a higher 7-day COVID-19 case average on Christmas Eve?
description:
This is a market about whether California or Florida will have a higher 7-day COVID-19 case average for the day of December 24, 2021. 

This market will resolve to “California” if the 7-day COVID-19 case average for California for December 24 is higher than in Florida. 
This market will resolve to “Florida” if the 7-day COVID-19 case average for December 24 is higher in Florida than in California. 
If the 7-day COVID-19 case averages are equal, the market will resolve to 50/50.  

The resolution source for this market will be https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#trends_dailytrendscases, the CDC's official count of Coronavirus cases. 

The data resolution source will be checked on January 1, 2022 at 8 PM ET in order to resolve this market. If the resolution source is unavailable for any reason at the designated time, or data for the day of December 24 is unavailable, it will be checked once every 24 hours for one week, after which the market will resolve based on another credible source if data is still unavailable.

question: Will the US Senate pass the Build Back Better Act by Christmas Eve?
description:
This is a market on whether the U.S. Senate will pass the Build Back Better Act (H.R.5376) before December 24, 2021, 11:59:59 pm ET.

This market will resolve to “Yes”, if H.R.5376 has “Passed Senate” before the resolution date, on the resolution source https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/5376. Credible news reports which state that the bill has passed the senate and that the vote is complete will also sufficient. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No."

Note, that the vote on this act must be finalized and closed ("gaveled") before midnight. Any ongoing vote that is not yet closed will be a "No" expiration.

---------------
This bill has passed the House on November 19th 2021 and is commonly referred to as the Build Back Better Act.

According to Congressional Research Service, this bill provides funding, establishes programs, and otherwise modifies provisions relating to a broad array of areas, including education, labor, child care, health care, taxes, immigration, and the environment.

question: Will the price of Wolf Game Wool ($WOOL) be above 10 cents at noon on December 7th?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Wolf Game World (WOOL) has a candlestick closing price of $0.100001 or more, as per resolution source, on December 7th 2021, 12 PM ET, and “No” otherwise. 

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/wolf-game-wool). 

This market will resolve on the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Tue 7 December 2021, 12:00:00”, with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. Note, this 12:00:00 candle lists the opening price for 11:30:00 PM ET and the closing price for 12:00:00 PM ET. 

The check will be at 12:30 PM ET December 7, 2021.

question: Will the Omicron variant be marked as a Variant Of High Consequence by the CDC before 2022?
description:
This is a market on if the CDC will denote variant B.1.1.529 (“Omicron”) under the heading Variant of High Consequence (VOHC) on its website before January 1, 2022, 12:00:01 AM ET. 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the resolution source shows B.1.1.529, "Omicron" or any label which references the Omicron variant in the VOHC category at any point before the resolution date, and “No” otherwise.    

The resolution for this market is https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/variants/variant-info.html which at the time of this market's inception states "Currently, there are no SARS-CoV-2 variants that rise to the level of high consequence."

Other CDC links may be used if the aforementioned link changes.

question: Will the FDA give emergency use authorization or otherwise approve Paxlovid before 2022?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if, by December 31, 2021, 11:59:59 PM ET, Paxlovid (also known under PF-07321332), or any product containing PF-07321332 receives an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) or full approval from the FDA for treating COVID-19. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No.” If the resolution source isn’t updated by the resolution date, credible news reports may be used instead.

Learn more about Paxlovid: https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-science-business-health-medication-eeea3c6a5f6428479e35bc1bcd7aec52.

question: NFL: Will the Cowboys beat the Saints by more than 3.5 points in their December 2nd matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NFL game, scheduled for December 2:

If the Dallas Cowboys win by over 3.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the New Orleans Saints lose by less than 3.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by December 10, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: NFL: Will the sum of points in Cowboys v. Saints be an even or an odd number?
description:
In the upcoming NFL game between Dallas Cowboys and New Orleans Saints, scheduled for December 2:

If the total sum of points scored is an even number (ie. score is 20-10, 14-24, 21-17...), this market will resolve to “Even”.

If the total sum of points scored is an odd number (ie. score is 20-27, 13-20, 10-17...), this market will resolve to “Odd”.

If the game is not completed by December 10, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Serie A: Who will win the Roma v. Inter Milan game on December 4?
description:
In the upcoming Serie A soccer game, scheduled for December 4:

If the AS Roma win, the market will resolve to “Roma.” 

If the Inter Milan win, the market will resolve to “Inter.” 

If the game is not completed by December 11, 2021, or there is a tie, the market will resolve 50-50

question: Serie A: Will the goal difference in Roma v. Inter Milan be more or less than 1?
description:
In the upcoming Serie A soccer game between AS Roma and Inter Milan, scheduled for December 4:

If the goal difference is greater than 1, this market will resolve to “More”.

If the goal difference is lower than 1, this market will resolve to “Less”.

If the goal difference equals 1 or this game is not completed by December 11, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

---------------------

Please note, the goal difference is the absolute difference between goals counted for each of the teams at the end of the game.

For example, if the final score is 0:1, 2:1, 5:4... - then the goal difference equals 1;
if the final score is 3:1, 2:0, 5:3... - then the goal difference equals 2;
if there is a draw, the goal difference equals 0, etc.

question: Will Ethereum reach $5000 by the end of 2021?
description: This market will resolve to “Yes” if the price of Ethereum (ETH) reaches $5000.00 as per Coingecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/ethereum, 'high' price) before December 31 2021, 11:59:59 PM ET, and “No” otherwise.
